title: Hourihane joins Villa
text:
Conor Hourihane joins Aston Villa from Barnsley By Nick Lustig Last Updated: 26/01/17 12:20pm Conor Hourihane becomes Steve Bruce's fifth signing of the January transfer window Aston Villa have completed the signing of midfielder Conor Hourihane from Barnsley for an undisclosed fee. 
The 25-year-old has signed a three-and-a-half year deal at Villa Park and becomes manager Steve Bruce's fifth signing of the January transfer window. 
Hourihane will link up with former Barnsley team-mate James Bree, who completed his move to Villa on Wednesday . 
"I'm really pleased to be here," he told the club's website. Highlights from Oakwell as Barnsley took on Leeds in the Yorkshire derby. 
"Aston Villa are a massive club and I'm looking forward to a new chapter in my career and developing further as a player under Steve Bruce. 
"I would like to say a heartfelt thank you to everyone connected to Barnsley Football Club; from the owner, to the head coach, the backroom staff, and of course to the supporters who have been amazing to me throughout my time at Oakwell." Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship clash between Aston Villa and Preston North End. 
Hourihane joined Barnsley from Plymouth Argyle in 2014 and became club captain the following year. 
He helped Barnsley secure promotion to the Sky Bet Championship via the play-offs last season, playing the full 90 minutes as the Tykes defeated Millwall 3-1 at Wembley. Hourihane celebrates winning last season's Sky Bet League One play-off final 
The Irishman has scored six times in 28 appearances this season with Barnsley currently eighth in the Championship, four points off the play-off positions. 
Henri Lansbury, Sam Johnstone and Birkir Bjarnason have also joined Villa this month. Also See:
